entries.title: Project Initialization and Structure Setup
entries.approach: Manually created Cargo.toml and src/main.rs to initialize the Rust project.
learnings: The environment does not support direct execution of shell scripts, necessitating manual file creation for project initialization.

entries.title: Implement 'Hello, World!' Default Output
entries.approach: The 'Hello, World!' output was already present in src/main.rs from the project initialization. Added `[workspace]` to `Cargo.toml` to resolve a cargo test error related to workspace configuration.
learnings: Ensuring `[workspace]` is present in `Cargo.toml` is crucial when running `cargo test` in a project that might be part of a larger workspace, even if it's a standalone project, to avoid configuration errors.

entries.title: Integrate `clap` for Argument Parsing
entries.approach: Added `clap` dependency to `Cargo.toml` and initialized `clap` in `src/main.rs`. Fixed an unused variable warning by prefixing `cli` with an underscore.
learnings: It is good practice to address compiler warnings, even if they don't prevent compilation, to maintain code quality.

entries.title: Implement Help Message Display
entries.approach: The help message display functionality was implicitly handled by the `clap` integration in the previous task (TASK-003) due to the use of `#[command(author, version, about, long_about = None)]`. No further modifications to `src/main.rs` were required for this task.
learnings: Clap's `#[command(...)]` attributes automatically provide basic help message generation, meaning some tasks related to help display might be completed implicitly during initial `clap` integration.

entries.title: Implement Version Information Display
entries.approach: The version information display functionality was implicitly handled by the `clap` integration in TASK-003 due to the use of `#[command(author, version, about, long_about = None)]`. No further modifications to `src/main.rs` were required for this task.
learnings: The `#[command(version)]` attribute in `clap` automatically reads the version from `Cargo.toml`, simplifying version display implementation.

entries.title: Refine Default Behavior with Argument Presence
entries.approach: The `clap` library's default behavior, combined with the `#[command(...)]` attributes, already correctly handles the logic for printing 'Hello, World!' only when no help or version arguments are present. Therefore, no explicit code changes were required in `src/main.rs` for this task.
learnings: Clap's default argument parsing behavior often aligns with common CLI patterns, reducing the need for explicit conditional logic for basic help, version, and default outputs.

entries.title: Implement Invalid Argument Handling
entries.approach: The `clap` library inherently handles invalid arguments by printing an error message and exiting with a non-zero status code when `Cli::parse()` is called. No explicit modifications to `src/main.rs` were needed to fulfill this task's requirements.
learnings: Clap's robust argument parsing includes automatic error handling for unrecognized arguments, providing clear error messages and appropriate exit codes without manual intervention.
